title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 358-3.7 - Notices and reports required with respect to plans
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 358-3.7 - Notices and reports required with respect to plans

State Regulations
(a) Whenever a plan accepted by the chairman
shall thereafter be modified or extended, written notice of such modification
or extension, in form approved by the chairman, shall be filed forthwith with
the chairman; and except as to modifications which are not material
modifications, and except for the extension of a new plan without material
modification for a fixed period of time specified in the agreement or
extension, no such modification shall be effective until it has been accepted
by the chairman and no such extension shall be effective until notice of
extension has been filed with the chairman. (b) A material modification of a plan shall
be effective on acceptance by the chairman; and, without limitation, any
modification which reduces the class or classes of employees to which the plan
is applicable or the rate of weekly benefits or the period during which
benefits are payable, or which increases the waiting period of the contribution
of employees to the cost of benefits, shall be deemed a material
modification. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
§§
358-3.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
